meta_description: Established in 1979, we are the only artist-founded museum in Los Angeles. We are dedicated to collecting and exhibiting contemporary art.
hours_text:
Photo by Elon Schoenholz, courtesy of The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles

## MOCA Grand Avenue

Architect Arata Isozaki designed MOCA Grand Avenue in 1986 with classical architecture and Los Angeles popular culture in mind. Today this location hosts the museumߴs main galleries, the flagship location of the MOCA Store, and staff offices.   

### Hours

Day | Hours  
---|---  
Mon  |  Closed   
Tues  |  11am - 5pm   
Wed  |  11am - 5pm   
Thur  |  11am - 8pm   
Fri  |  11am - 5pm   
**Sat** |  **11am - 6pm**  
Sun  |  11am - 6pm   
  
All visitors should reserve an online ticket. For your convenience, [reservations can be made in advance here](https://moca.ticketapp.org/portal/pages/tickets).

### Admission

Currently, all exhibitions on view at Grand Avenue are included in free general admission.  
  
General admission: Free  

### Tickets

Advance reservations are recommended.   
  
For your convenience, all visitors, including members, can make reservations in advance online [here](https://moca.ticketapp.org/portal/pages/tickets).   
  
A limited number of tickets will be available for purchase on-site, on a first-come, first-served basis.   
  
Phone reservations are also available by calling the MOCA Box Office at 213-633-5351 between Tuesday and Sunday, 11am–5pm.   
  
[](https://moca.ticketapp.org/portal/pages/tickets)

### Getting Here

250 South Grand Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90012   

MOCA encourages the use of public transportation; please use the [Metro Trip ...
